abstract: Former NHL star Rick Martin had chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a neurodegenerative disease linked to repeated brain trauma, when he died of a heart attack in March; he did not wear a helmet for most of his career and sustained no known brain trauma outside of hockey.
snippet: Rick Martin, the left wing on the Sabres’ French Connection line, had chronic traumatic encephalopathy when he died last March of a heart attack at age 59.
lead_paragraph: Rick Martin, the left wing on the Sabres’ French Connection line, had chronic traumatic encephalopathy when he died last March of a heart attack at age 59.

headline.main: Former Star Had Disease Linked to Brain Trauma
headline.print_headline: Former Star Had Disease Linked to Brain Trauma
headline.seo: Rick Martin Had Disease Related to Brain Trauma
